required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dynamic Contrast Enhanced Computed Tomography to Assess Radiation Therapy in Liver Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of Dynamic Contrast Enhanced Computed Tomography (DCE-CT) Imaging for the Assessment of Radiation Therapy Outcome for Liver Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a pilot study that uses a standard of care technique, Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy (SBRT), in combination with Dynamic Contrast Enhanced Computed Tomography (DCE-CT) to determine if perfusion changes from SBRT of liver cancer may be used for outcome assessment and prediction of prognosis.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will undergo standard of care SBRT while also receiving DCE-CT, also known as perfusion CT, pre-treatment, 6 hours post-treatment and 6 weeks post-treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Each patient will receive the standard of care, with the intervention, DCE-CT perfusion, occurring pre-treatment and post-treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of follow-up, up to 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Determine the association between the delivered radiation therapy dose distribution and the change in perfusion measurement through K-Trans (extraction-flow product) as shown through DCE-CT imaging.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of follow-up, up to 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Determine the association between the delivered radiation therapy dose distribution and the change in perfusion measurement through blood volume as shown through DCE-CT imaging.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of follow-up, up to 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Determine the association between the delivered radiation therapy dose distribution and the change in perfusion measurement through blood flow as shown through DCE-CT imaging.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and K-Trans: Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify K-Trans results by age to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and K-Trans: Sex
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify K-Trans results by sex to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and K-Trans: Race
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify K-Trans results by race to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and K-Trans: Clinical Stage of Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify K-Trans results by clinical stage at diagnosis to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and Blood Volume: Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify blood volume results age to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and Blood Volume: Sex
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify blood volume results sex to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and Blood Volume: Race
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify blood volume results race to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and Blood Volume: Clinical Stage of Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify blood volume results by clinical stage at diagnosis to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and Blood Flow: Age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify blood flow results age to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and Blood Flow: Sex
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify blood flow results sex to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and Blood Flow: Race
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify blood flow results race to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Between Patient Demographics and Blood Flow: Clinical Stage of Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post follow-up to end of study, up to 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify blood flow results by clinical stage at diagnosis to determine correlation of DCE-CT imaging results compared to patient demographics

arm_group.description: DCE-CT, also known as perfusion CT, is a functional imaging modality that uses repeated computed tomography imaging after injection of an iodine based contrast agent.

intervention.description: Patients will receive DCE-CT prior to the start of standard of care, Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy (SBRT), as well as 6 hours post administration of SBRT and 6 weeks post administration of SBRT.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Provision to sign and date the consent form
2. Stated willingness to comply with all study procedures and be available for the duration of the study
3. Be a Male or Female aged 18-100
4. Diagnosed with Liver HCC or metastases
5. Must be receiving or will plan to receive SBRT for Liver HCC or metastases
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Allergy to iodine contrast
2. CT with contrast not offered as a Standard of Care
3. Pregnant women
